topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545f10e16368723be2510100#post_545f10e16368723be2510100
"color represents calm it, that" I think you made a mistake there.

To be honest. Some parts like the Oscar Wilde quote and the ending almost feel patronizing, which could hurt your chances.

But I don't know how your school operates or what your professor is like.

Also. So your in games huh? that's neat.
topics.author: 500757fd7f123b75a90003b1

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545f10e16368723be2510100#post_545f10e16368723be2510100

Not gonna lie. He's probably gonna feel insulted when he reads it.

If there's one thing many teachers hate is a student knot only openly saying they more than them, is being lectured.

Add to the fact he seems to be the kind of teacher that seems to push his own personal ideas into the class instead of being objective and you end up with a time bomb.

There are ways of dealing with those people but I don't think you're willing to go with them, mostly because that would go against your principles.

Before you send it, freaking investigate this guy, talk with his colleagues, former students, people that have worked under him and have solid facts so that you can then properly react to his actions.

Best of luck
